articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The United States is trying to avert a greater war between Israel and Lebanon's Hezbollah movement, U.S. envoy Amos Hochstein said on Tuesday, following an escalation in cross-border fire between the foes along Lebanon's southern frontier.
articles.title: U.S. wants to avoid 'greater war' along Lebanon-Israel border, envoy says

articles.author: Thomas Escritt, Sarah Marsh
articles.description: Russia has turned increasingly to blackmail and financial incentives to hire Germans to spy for it after the blow dealt to its intelligence services by Europe's expulsion of some 600 Russian diplomats, Germany's domestic security service said.
articles.title: Russia buying spies to make up for expelled diplomats, German agency says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: NATO Secretary-General Jens Stoltenberg described Mark Rutte on Tuesday as a very strong candidate to replace him after the departing Dutch prime minister won the support of Hungary and Slovakia.
articles.title: NATO's Stoltenberg says Dutchman Rutte is a strong candidate to replace him

articles.author: Hyonhee Shin, Josh Smith
articles.description: Vladimir Putin promised to build trade and security systems with North Korea that are not controlled by the West and pledged his unwavering support in a letter published by North Korean state media on Tuesday ahead of his planned visit to the country.
articles.title: Putin vows trade, security agreements with North Korea ahead of visit

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The United Nations human rights chief on Tuesday warned that the rights situation in the West Bank, including East Jerusalem, was rapidly deteriorating, while there had been "unconscionable death and suffering" in Gaza.
articles.title: UN human rights chief: situation in West Bank 'drastically deteriorating'

articles.author: Chayut Setboonsarng, Panarat Thepgumpanat
articles.description: Thailand's Senate passed the final reading of a marriage equality law on Tuesday, paving the way for it to become the first country in Southeast Asia to recognise same-sex couples.
articles.title: Thailand passes marriage equality bill, first in Southeast Asia

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Israeli airstrikes on Tuesday killed at least 17 Palestinians in two of the Gaza Strip's historic refugee camps and Israeli tanks pushed deeper into the enclave's southern city of Rafah, residents and medics said.
articles.title: Israeli forces deepen Rafah invasion, kill 17 in central camps

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The United States on Tuesday imposed sanctions on two individuals and a network of companies generating wealth for Bosnian Serb nationalist leader Milorad Dodik and his family, the U.S. Treasury Department said in a statement.
articles.title: US imposes sanctions targeting Bosnian Serb leader Dodik's network of firms

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Tens of thousands of Muslim-minority Rohingya, who were feared to be trapped amid fighting in western Myanmar, had nowhere to flee, the United Nations human rights chief said on Tuesday.
articles.title: UN rights chief: Rohingya have 'nowhere to flee' in western Myanmar fighting

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Ukraine is investigating the suspected beheading of one of its servicemen by Russian forces in an occupied part of the eastern Donetsk region, the Ukrainian general prosecutor's office said on Tuesday.
articles.title: Ukraine investigates suspected beheading of soldier by Russia, prosecutors say
